net.sf.mmm.util.component.api

Interface Ioc


  • public interface Ioc
    This interface is only used for documentation of what is meant by the terms IoC.
    IoC is a shortcut for Inversion of Control that is an excellent design pattern supporting SoC (separation of concerns). If a component A has a dependency on some other component B it simply aggregates the interface of the other component B and typically offers a public setter taking the interface of B as argument. This way the component A has no knowledge about how to instantiate or configure the component B. Instead a central IocContainer manages all components and takes care of these dependencies and injects the instance of B into A. This process is called dependency injection (DI). Therefore the implementation of component B can be replaced without touching component A. This pattern is the key to a maintainable architecture.

    Important:
    Please see CDI for the details how to realize the IoC pattern in Java.
    Since:
    3.1.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)
